intro: Hijmania scaphigera, commonly known as the scarlet sage, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its striking red or purple tubular flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Hijmania scaphigera thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
